page.title: 07HOW DITTON DEVELOPED(WIDNES)
page.content: The name{Ditton,}or{Dytton}is a form of the Anglo Saxon Dictum _{a diked {or ditched enclosure.}It was an Anglo_Saxon settlement dating from the seventh century. The land escaped the industrial organisation of Widnes and remained rural until the early 1950's. In{1935}the new{Halebank Estate rehoused people from the Widnes slums. By{1951}the{population}of Widnes had grown to{48,795}and more housing was needed.The rural area of Ditton was used to house the expanding population. { Oakfield Infants}school was opened in {1954. Bankfield Secondary}school in {1958}and{Oakfield Junior}school in {1959.}The once separate communities of{Widnes Dock, Ditton, Appleton}and {Farnworth}are now linked in one compact mass by the housing needs of the people.
